children.text:
Script for a talk show.
Working Title: Endless Forms Most Beautiful 2.0-- Tales From The Frontiers of Biology

Background: "The rich variety of biological forms and behaviours results from one evolutionary history on Earth, via frozen accidents and selection in specific environments. This ubiquitous baggage in natural, familiar model species obscures the plasticity and swarm intelligence of cellular collectives. Significant gaps exist in our understanding of the origin of anatomical novelty, of the relationship between genome and form, and of strategies for control of large-scale structure and function in regenerative medicine and bioengineering. Analysis of living forms that have never existed before is necessary to reveal deep design principles of life as it can be. We briefly review existing examples of chimaeras, cyborgs, hybrots and other beings along the spectrum containing evolved and designed systems. To drive experimental progress in multicellular synthetic morphology, we propose teleonomic (goal-seeking, problem-solving) behaviour in diverse problem spaces as a powerful invariant across possible beings regardless of composition or origin. Cybernetic perspectives on chimaeric morphogenesis erase artificial distinctions established by past limitations of technology and imagination. We suggest that a multi-scale competency architecture facilitates evolution of robust problem-solving, living machines. Creation and analysis of novel living forms will be an essential testbed for the emerging field of diverse intelligence, with numerous implications across regenerative medicine, robotics and ethics."

Outline: Host comes on, introduces the hybrot orchestra and talks about the guests that will be on the show:

Dr. Aguirre is part of a group of scientists looking beyond the traditional boundaries of biology and biology- related fields of study. Thanks for joining us.

Chimera Scientist, an amphibian scientist and the Bacterium that grants wishes talk about their origin.

The Chiroptoid from Titan asks the Amphibian scientist why so many animals have immobile males and he is told that the biggest problem for males is getting their genes into the next generation, hence most males are pushovers in order to

attract the maximum number of females.

The Amphibian scientist disappears and the Immune system shepherd and the Bacterium that grants wishes analyse the frog.

A cell phone rings and the Cell answers it, followed by the Bacterium that grants wishes. They are pressed by the audience to talk about themselves and they both do so in their own way.

The moderator jokes around with the Caenorhabditis elegans, the Uber-E. coli and the

attract a mate, which is why some males die for the cause, as opposed to dying for nothing. The amphibian scientist also mentions that female animals are attracted to colourful objects better than male animals, which is why the Chiroptoid from Titan has a color changing skin. The Chiroptoid from Titan also states that it is very hot on Titan, so the only place for him to cool down and not be a running target for predators is up in the trees where he is safe.

mate.

The Amphibian scientist tells the hive of intelligent cells about animals so that these cells can choose to live like that or not. The cells are then shown the flies from the Amazonian butterfly chrysalis, the Apis Drones in the hive, and the Vervet Monkeys that let the other monkeys work for them. The intelligent cells choose to live like the Vervet Monkeys, understanding the unequal distribution of the workload and their fair share of the tasks that

attract females. The male talks about courtship dancing, singing, size and appearance as attributes with which males attract females, but also about the fact that several of these are costly to have since they require a great amount of energy and in several cases may have been dropped by male populations because of this cost.
A new mosaic organism called Synergy (1:50) is presented, which contains salamander cells, frog cells, human cells and mouse cells. This creature was the creation of one
